level.text: 529.1 Each EMS educational institution shall have a program director who:
Has at least two (2) years of experience instructing and evaluating EMS students;
Has experience with administration of educational programs;
Has an instructor certification equivalent to the course level being instructed; and
Has knowledge of the District scope of practice for Emergency Medical Services Providers and the National Educational Standards.
Have overall responsibility for the success of the education program, including continuous quality review and improvement of the education program;
Serve as the education program student and faculty liaison;
Identify sites where students can fulfill field internship requirements; and
Keep the medical director informed of the program schedule, progress of individual student performance, student or instructor complaints, and the status of other program activities.
The medical director may also act as the program director.
